SENT.plain: We report a 3-month-old male with infantile hypophosphatasia who later developed Pseudotumor cerebri
At the age of 3 months, he was referred to our hospital because of pneumonia and respiratory insufficiency
He had short extremities, and radiographs of the bones were consistent with lack of metaphyseal mineralization and bowed lower extremities
Vomiting and bulging fontanelle developed 3 months after admission, and CSF opening pressure was notably high at 430 mm/H2O
Hypophosphatasia is a very rare cause of pseudotumor cerebri
This report is the first case where PTC is associated with hypophosphatasia and responded well to corticosteroid therapy
